com.mvohm.quadruple.test

Class AuxMethods

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mvohm.quadruple.test.AuxMethods

  • public class AuxMethods
extends Object
    A set of convenience static methods to be used by other classes of the quadruple.test package. Includes mainly a number of methods to convert values of various types to each other, and to output values to console.
    Author:
    M.Vokhmentev

      Calculates and returns a BigDecimal product of the given factors, with the accuracy of p - n, where p is the precision determined by the mc parameter, and n is the number of the factors.
      static BigDecimal mult(Number... factors)
      Calculates and returns a BigDecimal product of the given factors, with accuracy of 120 - n decimal digits, where n is the amount of the factors.
      static void openLog(String filename)
      Opens a simplest 'logger' (actually, a simple text file with the given name) to write something to, while debugging.
      static BigDecimal powerOfTwo(int exp)
      Calculates two raised to power exp with the accuracy of 140 decimal digits.
      static BigDecimal powerOfTwo(long exp, MathContext mc)
      Calculates two raised to power exp with the accuracy defined by the mc argument.
      static String quadToString43(Quadruple value)
      Converts the value of the given Quadruple instance to a String representation formatted as a decimal number in computerized scientific notation with 43 digits after the point (similar to formatting BigDecimal with format string "%.e43").
      static String quadToString80(Quadruple value)
      Converts the value of the given Quadruple instance to a String representation formatted as a decimal number in computerized scientific notation with 80 digits after the point (similar to formatting BigDecimal with format string "%.e80").

      • hexStr

        public static String hexStr(double dValue)
        Returns a hexadecimal string representation of the given double value showing its sign, mantissa, and exponent separately, e.g. "-6_a09e_667f_3bcd e 3ff"
        Parameters:
        dValue - the value to convert to hexadecimal string
        Returns:
        the hexadecimal string representation of the given double value

      • hexStr

        public static String hexStr(Quadruple qValue)
        Returns a hexadecimal string representation of the given Quadruple value showing its sign, mantissa, and exponent separately, e.g. "+3c7e_7dc8_2aef_ddf3 ab41_94a5_1831_2fce e 10ac_83b0"
        Parameters:
        qValue - the value to convert to hexadecimal string
        Returns:
        the hexadecimal string representation of the given Quadruple value

      • hexStr

        public static String hexStr(long[] buffer)
        Returns a hexadecimal string representation of the given array of longs, with digits grouped by 4. Places each item in a new line, preceded by its index, e.g. 
           0: 79a5_120e_08e4_6ad2
   1: ffff_ffff_742f_c7cb
   2: abcd_ef01_2345_6789
        Had been used while debugging. Currently not used, but may still be useful in the future.
        Parameters:
        buffer - the buffer of longs to be represented as hex strings
        Returns:
        a string with hexadecimal representation of the contents of the buffer, as described above

      • hexStr_u

        public static String hexStr_u(long[] buffer)
        Returns a hexadecimal string representation of the given array of longs, treating it as an 'unpacked' value, i.e a buffer where all the elements except the first one contain non-null values in their least significant 32 bits only (this format is used by Quadruple internally). If the buffer has an odd number of items, the last value will be complemented with 0. For example, a buffer containing 
         0: 0000_0001_2222_2222
 1: 3333_3333_4444_4444
 2: abcd_ef01_2345_6789
 3: 1234_5678_fedc_ba98
        will be shown like 
        0000_0001 2222_2222_4444_4444 2345_6789_fedc_ba98
        Had been used while debugging. Currently not used, but may still be useful in the future.
        Parameters:
        buffer - the buffer of longs to be represented as hex strings
        Returns:
        a string with hexadecimal representation of the contents of the buffer, as described above

      • hexStr_

        public static String hexStr_(long[] longs)
        Returns a hexadecimal string representation of the given array of longs, with digits grouped by 4. Places all values in a single line, e.g. 
          1111_1111_2222_2222 3333_3333_4444_4444 abcd_ef01_2345_6789
        Parameters:
        longs - the buffer of longs to be represented as a hex string
        Returns:
        a string with hexadecimal representation of the contents of the buffer, as described above

      • hexStr_

        public static String hexStr_(int[] ints)

      • hexStr_

        public static String hexStr_(byte[] bytes)
        Returns a hexadecimal string representation of the given array of bytess, with digits grouped by 4. Places all values in a single line, e.g. 
          1111 2222 3333 4444 abcd ef01 2345 6789
        Parameters:
        bytes - the buffer of bytess to be represented as a hex string
        Returns:
        a string with hexadecimal representation of the contents of the buffer, as described above

      • binStr

        public static String binStr(long lValue)
        Returns a string representing the bits of the argument.
        1 is depicted with '#', and 0 with '_', so that 
        0xABCD_EF01_2345_6789L
        will be shown as 
        #_#_ #_## ##__ ##_# ###_ #### ____ ___# __#_ __## _#__ _#_# _##_ _### #___ #__#.

        Had been used while debugging. Currently not used, but may still be useful in the future.
        Parameters:
        lValue - the value to show
        Returns:
        a string representing the bits of the argument

      • bigDecimalValueOf

        public static BigDecimal bigDecimalValueOf(Quadruple qValue)
        Calculates the value stored by the instance of Quadruple, using the values of its fields, rounds it to 140 decimal digits, and returns it as BigDecimal.
        Parameters:
        qValue - a Quadruple instance to extract the value from
        Returns:
        the value of the given Quadruple as BigDecimal

      • buildQuadruple

        public static Quadruple buildQuadruple(BigDecimal value)
        Creates a new Quadruple instance containing the value passed in the value parameter. If the exact value of the argument can't be represented as a Quadruple, it is rounded in accordance with the 'half-up' rule.
        Parameters:
        value - the value to assign to the newly-created Quadruple instance
        Returns:
        the newly-created Quadruple instance with the value of the argument, perhaps rounded.

      • buildQuadruple

        public static Quadruple buildQuadruple(BigDecimal value,
                                       Quadruple result)
        Constructs a Quadruple containing the value passed in the value parameter and puts it into the result parameter. If the result parameter is null, creates a new Quadruple instance, otherwise assigns the value of the value parameter to the given Quadruple instance. If the value of the argument can't be expressed by a Quadruple exactly, it's get rounded in accordance with the `half-up' rule.
        Parameters:
        value - the value to assign to the given or a newly-created Quadruple instance
        result - an instance of Quadruple to assign the value to, or null
        Returns:
        the given or a newly-created Quadruple instance with the value of the value argument, perhaps rounded.

      • quadToString43

        public static String quadToString43(Quadruple value)
        Converts the value of the given Quadruple instance to a String representation formatted as a decimal number in computerized scientific notation with 43 digits after the point (similar to formatting BigDecimal with format string "%.e43"). For Infinity, -Infinity, and NaN returns their respective string notations.
        Parameters:
        value - a Quadruple instance to format its value
        Returns:
        a string representation of the given Quadruple value

      • quadToString80

        public static String quadToString80(Quadruple value)
        Converts the value of the given Quadruple instance to a String representation formatted as a decimal number in computerized scientific notation with 80 digits after the point (similar to formatting BigDecimal with format string "%.e80"). For Infinity, -Infinity, and NaN returns their respective string notations.
        Parameters:
        value - a Quadruple instance to format its value
        Returns:
        a string representation of the given Quadruple value

      • formatQuadruple

        public static String formatQuadruple(String format,
                                     Quadruple value)
        Converts the value of the given Quadruple instance to a String representation formatted in accordance with the given format string. For Infinity, -Infinity and NaN returns their respective string notations.
        Parameters:
        format - a format string to format the value
        value - a Quadruple instance to format its value
        Returns:
        a string representation of the given Quadruple value

      • buildQuadruple

        public static Quadruple buildQuadruple(String value)
        Creates a new Quadruple instance containing the value passed in the value parameter.
        Parameters:
        value - a string representation of the value to be assigned to the new Quadruple instance
        Returns:
        the newly-created instance of Quadruple with the given value
        Throws:
        NumberFormatException - if value is not a valid string representation of a Quadruple.

      • buildQuadruple

        public static Quadruple buildQuadruple(String value,
                                       Quadruple result)
        Constructs a Quadruple containing the value passed in the value parameter and puts it in the result. If the result parameter is null, creates a new Quadruple instance, otherwise assigns the value of the value parameter to the given Quadruple instance.
        Parameters:
        value - a string representation of the value to be assigned to the new Quadruple instance
        result - a Quadruple instance to assign the new value to, or null to create a new instance
        Returns:
        an instance passed in the result argument, or a newly-created instance of Quadruple with the given value
        Throws:
        NumberFormatException - if value is not a valid string representation of a Quadruple.

      • bd

        public static BigDecimal bd(String value)
        Converts the value represented by the given String to a BigDecimal.
        Parameters:
        value - a value expressed as a String
        Returns:
        a BigDecimal with the value of the given argument
        Throws:
        NumberFormatException - if value is not a valid representation of a BigDecimal.
        See Also:
        BigDecimal.BigDecimal(String)

      • bd

        public static BigDecimal bd(boolean sign,
                            long mantHi,
                            long mantLo,
                            int exponent)
        Builds a BigDecimal whose value is equal to the value that a Quadruple would have if it were built of the given parts, with an accuracy of 140 decimal digits. If the value is not convertible to BigDecimal (NaN or Infinity), NumberFormatException is thrown.
        Parameters:
        sign - the sign of the corresponding Quadruple, true for negative values
        mantHi - the most significant 64 bits of the mantissa of the corresponding Quadruple
        mantLo - the least significant 64 bits of the mantissa of the corresponding Quadruple
        exponent - the exponent of the corresponding Quadruple
        Returns:
        a BigDecimal with the value of a Quadruple built of the given parts
        Throws:
        NumberFormatException - if the value of the corresponding Quadruple can't be expressed as BigDecimal

      • bd

        public static BigDecimal bd(long mantHi,
                            long mantLo,
                            int exponent)
        Builds a non-negative BigDecimal whose value is equal to the value that a Quadruple would have if it were built of the given parts, with an accuracy of 140 decimal digits. If the value is not convertible to BigDecimal (NaN or Infinity), NumberFormatException is thrown.
        Parameters:
        mantHi - the most significant 64 bits of the mantissa of the corresponding Quadruple
        mantLo - the least significant 64 bits of the mantissa of the corresponding Quadruple
        exponent - the exponent of the corresponding Quadruple
        Returns:
        a BigDecimal with the value of a Quadruple built of the given parts
        Throws:
        NumberFormatException - if the value of the corresponding Quadruple can't be expressed as BigDecimal

        op2 - the second summand
        mc - a MathContest instance that defines the precision of the calculation
        Returns:
        the resulting quotient

      • mult

        public static BigDecimal mult(Number... factors)
        Calculates and returns a BigDecimal product of the given factors, with accuracy of 120 - n decimal digits, where n is the amount of the factors.
        Parameters:
        factors - an array of factors to multiply
        Returns:
        the product of the given factors

      • mult

        public static BigDecimal mult(MathContext mc,
                              Number... factors)
        Calculates and returns a BigDecimal product of the given factors, with the accuracy of p - n, where p is the precision determined by the mc parameter, and n is the number of the factors.
        Parameters:
        mc - a MathContext instance defining the precision and the rounding mode of the multiplication
        factors - an array of factors to be multiplied
        Returns:
        the product of the given factors

        op2 - the divisor
        Returns:

      • bdStr

        public static String bdStr(boolean sign,
                           long mantHi,
                           long mantLo,
                           int exponent)
        Builds a BigDecimal whose value is equal to the value that a Quadruple would have if it were built of the given parts, with an accuracy of 140 decimal places, and returns its String representation. For Infinity, -Infinity, and NaN returns their respective string notations.
        Parameters:
        sign - the sign of the corresponding Quadruple, true for negative values
        mantHi - the most significant 64 bits of the mantissa of the corresponding Quadruple
        mantLo - the least significant 64 bits of the mantissa of the corresponding Quadruple
        exponent - the exponent of the corresponding Quadruple
        Returns:
        a decimal String representation of the value of a Quadruple built of the given parts

      • bdStr

        public static String bdStr(boolean sign,
                           long mantHi,
                           long mantLo,
                           long exponent)
        Builds a BigDecimal whose value is equal to the value that a Quadruple would have if it were built of the given parts, with an accuracy of 140 decimal places, and returns its String representation. For Infinity, -Infinity, and NaN returns their respective string notations.
        Parameters:
        sign - the sign of the corresponding Quadruple, true for negative values
        mantHi - the most significant 64 bits of the mantissa of the corresponding Quadruple
        mantLo - the least significant 64 bits of the mantissa of the corresponding Quadruple
        exponent - the exponent of the corresponding Quadruple
        Returns:
        a decimal String representation of the value of a Quadruple built of the given parts

      • bdStr

        public static String bdStr(long mantHi,
                           long mantLo,
                           int exponent)
        Builds a non-negative BigDecimal whose value is equal to the value that a Quadruple would have if it were built of the given parts, with an accuracy of 140 decimal places, and returns its String representation. For Infinity and NaN returns their respective string notations.
        Parameters:
        mantHi - the most significant 64 bits of the mantissa of the corresponding Quadruple
        mantLo - the least significant 64 bits of the mantissa of the corresponding Quadruple
        exponent - the exponent of the corresponding Quadruple
        Returns:
        a decimal String representation of the value of a Quadruple built of the given parts

        Builds a non-negative BigDecimal whose value is equal to the value that a Quadruple would have if it were built of the given parts, with an accuracy of 140 decimal places, and returns its String representation. For Infinity and NaN returns their respective string notations.
        Parameters:

        exponent - the exponent of the corresponding Quadruple

        a decimal String representation of the value of a Quadruple built of the given parts

      • bdStr

        public static String bdStr(BigDecimal value)
        Returns a string representation of this BigDecimal, using scientific notation if an exponent is needed. Simply calls BigDecimal.toString(), actually.
        Parameters:
        value - the value to convert to String
        Returns:
        a String representation of the given value
        See Also:
        BigDecimal.toString()

      • bdStr

        public static String bdStr(Number value)
        Returns a string representation of this Number, using scientific notation if an exponent is needed. Converts the given number to a BigDecimal and calls its toString() method, actually.
        Parameters:
        value - the value to convert to String
        Returns:
        a String representation of the given value
        See Also:
        BigDecimal.toString()

      • str

        static String str(Number value)
        Returns a string representation of this Number, using scientific notation with 50 digits after the point.
        Parameters:
        value - the value to convert to a String
        Returns:
        a String representation of the given value

      • str

        static String str(double value)
        Returns a string representation of this double value.

        The returned representation is exactly the one returned by the Double.toString() called with the given argument..

        Parameters:
        value - the value to convert to a String
        Returns:
        a String representation of the given value
        See Also:
        Double.toString(double)

      • str

        static String str(long value)
        Returns the string representation of this long value.

        The returned representation is exactly the one returned by the Long.toString() called with the given argument.

        Parameters:
        value - the value to convert to a String
        Returns:
        a String representation of the given value
        See Also:
        Long.toString(long)

      • sqrt

        public static BigDecimal sqrt(BigDecimal arg)
        Calculates the square root of the given BigDecimal value using the Babylonian algorithm, with the precision of 1e-85.
        Parameters:
        arg - the argument of the square root
        Returns:
        the value of the square root
        Throws:
        ArithmeticException - if the argument is negative

      • powerOfTwo

        public static BigDecimal powerOfTwo(int exp)
        Calculates two raised to power exp with the accuracy of 140 decimal digits.
        Parameters:
        exp - the power to raise 2 to
        Returns:
        the value of two raised to the given power

      • powerOfTwo

        public static BigDecimal powerOfTwo(long exp,
                                    MathContext mc)
        Calculates two raised to power exp with the accuracy defined by the mc argument.
        Parameters:
        exp - the power to raise 2 to
        mc - MathContext that defines the precision
        Returns:
        the value of two raised to the given power

      • openLog

        public static void openLog(String filename)
                    throws FileNotFoundException
        Opens a simplest 'logger' (actually, a simple text file with the given name) to write something to, while debugging.
        Had been used while debugging. Currently not used, but may still be useful in the future.
        Parameters:
        filename - the path to the file to open
        Throws:
        FileNotFoundException - If the given file object does not denote an existing, writable regular file and a new regular file of that name cannot be created, or if some other error occurs while attempting to opening or to create the file
        See Also:
        PrintStream.PrintStream(String)

      • log

        public static void log()
        == logFile.println();

      • log

        public static void log(Object o)
        == logFile.println(o);
        Parameters:
        o - the object to write to the log

      • log_

        public static void log_(Object o)
        == logFile.print(o);
        Parameters:
        o - the object to write to the log

      • log

        public static void log(String format,
                       Object... args)
        == logFile.println(String.format(format, args));
        Parameters:
        format - a format string to format the arguments
        args - the arguments to write to the log

      • log_

        public static void log_(String format,
                        Object... args)
        == logFile.print(String.format(format, args));
        Parameters:
        format - a format string to format the arguments
        args - the arguments to write to the log

        public static void closeLog()
        Closes the 'logger'
